newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH CBS TO PUBLISH EU-HARMONISED CPI ON FRIDAY.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH CBS TO PUBLISH EU-HARMONISED CPI ON FRIDAY.

text.p: The Dutch Central Bureau of
Statistics (CBS) said on Wednesday it would start to publish
inflation figures on Friday which would be harmonised with those
of other European Union (EU) member states.
The CBS said this would enable a better comparison of
inflation rates of EU states. The harmonised rate, which will be
used to judge which EU members meet inflation criteria for
European economic and monetary union (EMU), will be published
alongside existing consumer price index (CPI) data.
"The harmonised index differs from the existing consumer
price index on several points," the CBS said.
It said the main difference was in the package of goods used
to calculate the change in consumer prices (see table below).

But both indices use the 1990 consumption pattern as their
basis.
The data to be published on Friday will be for February.
